problem_summary_simple: Count unique pairs in an array with an absolute difference of k.
problem_summary_technical: Uses two hash sets to store seen numbers and unique pairs, achieving O(n) time complexity for finding pairs with difference k.
key_insights: Using a hash set (lookup) allows checking for `num - k` and `num + k` in O(1) time.
A second hash set (result) is crucial to store unique pairs, preventing duplicates.
Handle k=0 as a special case where we count numbers appearing more than once.
